Package es.upm.pproject.parkingjam.parking_jam.model

Class LevelConverter

java.lang.Object
es.upm.pproject.parkingjam.parking_jam.model.LevelConverter
public class LevelConverter extends Object
The 'LevelConverter' class is responsible for converting a 2D character array representation of a game level into a map of 'Car' objects. It validates the level by checking the number of exits and the dimensions of the cars.

  • Method Details

    • convertLevel

      public Map<Character,Car> convertLevel(char[][] board) throws IllegalExitsNumberException, IllegalCarDimensionException
      Converts a 2D character array board representation into a map of 'Car' objects.
      Parameters:
      board - the 2D character array representing the level.
      Returns:
      a map where keys are characters representing cars and values are 'Car' objects.
      Throws:
      IllegalExitsNumberException - if the number of exits in the level is not exactly one.
      IllegalCarDimensionException - if any car has invalid dimensions. Example Board: 
      
 char[][] board = {
     {'+', '+', '+', '+', '+', '+', '+'},
     {'+', 'A', ' ', ' ', ' ', 'B', '+'},
     {'+', 'A', ' ', '*', '*', 'B', '@'},
     {'+', 'A', ' ', ' ', ' ', ' ', '+'},
     {'+', '+', '+', '+', '+', '+', '+'}
 };
      Example Result: 
      
 {
     'A' -> Car{symbol='A', x=1, y=1, l=3, o='V'},
     'B' -> Car{symbol='B', x=5, y=1, l=2, o='V'},
     '*' -> Car{symbol='*', x=3, y=2, l=2, o='H'}
 }
